messages.messageBody:

brenjenem@... writes:
Other well meaning people have been pointing it out to me lately that he
should see a speech therapist. <<<<<

I think *they* might need to see a hearing specialist! <G>

~Kelly

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Speech? Gail
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 2/25/2004 5:56:37 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... My son is 9 and still has trouble pronouncing his r s and s and L. He does not want to go to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 2/25/2004 5:56:37 AM Eastern Standard Time,
gailbrocop@... writes:


> I'm also a speech therapist. Speech sounds are developmental.

My son is 9 and still has trouble pronouncing his r's and s and L. He does
not want to go to a speech therapist at this point. Is there any way I can help
him at home? R seems to make him sound the most "babyish." Other well meaning
people have been pointing it out to me lately that he should see a speech
therapist.
Thank you, Teresa


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
